name: libgd

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
GD is an open source code library for the dynamic creation of images by
programmers. GD is written in C, and "wrappers" are available for Perl,
PHP and other languages. GD creates PNG, JPEG, GIF, WebP, XPM, BMP
images, among other formats. GD is commonly used to generate charts,
graphics, thumbnails, and most anything else, on the fly. While not
restricted to use on the web, the most common applications of GD involve
website development.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: iconv
dependencies.description: Dummy package to provide interfaces available in libc.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
libjpeg is a widely used free library with functions for handling the
JPEG image data format. It implements a JPEG codec (encoding and
decoding) alongside various utilities for handling JPEG data.

dependencies.name: libtiff
dependencies.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependent_to.name: emboss
dependent_to.description:
EMBOSS is a free Open Source software analysis package specially
developed for the needs of the molecular biology (e.g. EMBnet) user
community

dependent_to.name: texlive
dependent_to.description:
TeX Live is an easy (we hope) way to get up and running with the TeX
document production system. It provides a comprehensive TeX system with
binaries for most flavors of Unix, including GNU/Linux, macOS, and also
Windows. It includes all the major TeX-related programs, macro packages,
and fonts that are free software, including support for many languages
around the world.

dependent_to.name: mscgen
dependent_to.description:
Mscgen is a small program that parses Message Sequence Chart
descriptions and produces PNG, SVG, EPS or server side image maps
(ismaps) as the output.

dependent_to.name: grads
dependent_to.description:
The Grid Analysis and Display System (GrADS) is an interactive desktop
tool that is used for easy access, manipulation, and visualization of
earth science data. GrADS has two data models for handling gridded and
station data. GrADS supports many data file formats, including binary
(stream or sequential), GRIB (version 1 and 2), NetCDF, HDF (version 4
and 5), and BUFR (for station data).

dependent_to.name: gnuplot
dependent_to.description:
Gnuplot is a portable command-line driven graphing utility for Linux,
OS/2, MS Windows, OSX, VMS, and many other platforms. The source code is
copyrighted but freely distributed (i.e., you don't have to pay for it).
It was originally created to allow scientists and students to visualize
mathematical functions and data interactively, but has grown to support
many non-interactive uses such as web scripting. It is also used as a
plotting engine by third-party applications like Octave. Gnuplot has
been supported and under active development since 1986
